sense.name: destroy
sense.examples: Djibouti vandals wrecked the well. After Hurricane Katrina wrecked the city, Google updated Maps and Earth with images of the devastation. Thatcherism wrecked the Tory party and opened the way for new Labour. I wish he had wrecked the damn car. Saturday I wrecked our plans to go to the beach because I'm doing a transport. Their philosophy of education wrecked the schools. Who wrecked the movies? The terror ordeal and lies over rape wrecked the life of an innocent man.
